newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan cotton rates close steady, seen stable.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan cotton rates close steady, seen stable.

text.p: Pakistani cotton rates closed steady on Saturday on low demand from textile mills and are likely to open stable after Sunday's weekend, dealers said.
The rates closed unchanged as most of the big mills had bought enough stocks to last untl mid-March, a dealer at the private Karachi Cotton Association (KCA) said.
In the kerb market, the NIAB-78 variety was quoted between 2,250 and 2,350 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) and the MNH-93 between 2,525 and 2,575 rupees.
Saturday's KCA official spot rates in rupees per maund:
